body:
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Opponent had the card "Marshal Law".
2.Choose one of two "Deathbringer Liege", a "Souls of the Fautless" also there but not relevant. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Both Lieges were able to attack despite the fact one of them should have been unable due to detain. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? 1.36 on Windows 7
author: [nmd...@mta.ca](https://code.google.com/u/106381096949014499511/)
title: Detain isn't stopping monsters from attacking

comments.body: Figured it out, I'm an idiot.
comments.author: [nmd...@mta.ca](https://code.google.com/u/106381096949014499511/)

comments.body: "Figured it out" as in this is not a bug?
comments.author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)

content:
_From [nmd...@mta.ca](https://code.google.com/u/106381096949014499511/) on April 19, 2013 16:52:42_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Opponent had the card "Marshal Law".
2.Choose one of two "Deathbringer Liege", a "Souls of the Fautless" also there but not relevant. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Both Lieges were able to attack despite the fact one of them should have been unable due to detain. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? 1.36 on Windows 7

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/magarena/issues/detail?id=343_
